Home Is Where the Herz Is

[/td_block_text_with_title][td_block_text_with_title f_post_font_family=”file_1″ f_post_font_size=”20px” f_post_font_line_height=”25px” f_post_font_weight=”500″ tdc_css=”eyJhbGwiOnsibWFyZ2luLXRvcCI6IjUlIiwibWFyZ2luLXJpZ2h0IjoiMTAlIiwibWFyZ2luLWJvdHRvbSI6IjEwJSIsIm1hcmdpbi1sZWZ0IjoiMTAlIiwiZGlzcGxheSI6IiJ9fQ==”]

Over 570,000 Viennese have non-Austrian citizenship. Over 770,000 Viennese were born abroad or have parents who moved here from elsewhere – making up over 40% of the city’s population. That’s a higher share than in New York City!

This year, Metropole is embarking on the new reporting project “Home Is Where the Herz Is” to give a voice to the 10 largest communities who have made Vienna home.

The content comes from young Viennese journalists with roots in the communities, supported and guided by the Metropole team. Ten print publications, lots of online and social media content, monthly offline get-togethers and much more awaits you there. Stay tuned!

Here are the communities and issues:

Romanian – Home Is Where Inima ta Is

Hungarian – Home Is Where A Szíved Is

Polish – Home Is Where Serce Is

Serbian – Home Is Where срце Is

German – Home Is Where the Herz Is

Bulgarian – Home Is Where the сърце Is

Syrian – Home Is Where القلب Is

Turkish – Home Is Where the Kalp Is

Bosnian – Home Is Where the Srce Is

Croatian – Home Is Where the Srce Is

[/td_block_text_with_title][tdm_block_button button_text=”Click here to pre-order all 10 issues or buy one at a time!” button_size=”tdm-btn-lg” button_display=”tdm-block-button-inline” button_icon_space=”17″ content_align_horizontal=”content-horiz-left” button_url=”https://metropole.at/product/herz-special-issues/” button_open_in_new_window=”yes” tds_button=”tds_button1″ tds_button1-background_color=”#4db2ec” float_right=”yes” tds_button1-f_btn_text_font_weight=”700″ tdc_css=”eyJhbGwiOnsibWFyZ2luLXJpZ2h0IjoiOTAiLCJkaXNwbGF5IjoiIn19″][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/2″ tdc_css=”eyJhbGwiOnsiY29udGVudC1oLWFsaWduIjoiY29udGVudC1ob3Jpei1jZW50ZXIiLCJkaXNwbGF5IjoiIn19″][td_block_text_with_title]

If you are involved in a community organization, run a business, a newspaper, a website, social media page or event series and you or your parents have roots abroad, get in touch with us. We’d love to partner with you for this project!

[/td_block_text_with_title][td_block_title title_tag=”h4″ custom_title=”CONTRIBUTE!” f_header_font_size=”24PX” f_header_font_line_height=”32px” f_header_font_family=”file_1″ f_header_font_weight=”600″ tdc_css=”eyJhbGwiOnsibWFyZ2luLXJpZ2h0IjoiNSUiLCJtYXJnaW4tbGVmdCI6IjUlIiwiZGlzcGxheSI6IiJ9fQ==”][td_block_text_with_title tdc_css=”eyJhbGwiOnsibWFyZ2luLXJpZ2h0IjoiMTAlIiwibWFyZ2luLWJvdHRvbSI6IjEwJSIsIm1hcmdpbi1sZWZ0IjoiNSUiLCJkaXNwbGF5IjoiIn19″ f_post_font_family=”file_1″ f_post_font_size=”20px” f_post_font_line_height=”25px” f_post_font_weight=”500″]

If you want to contribute to this project, send your idea to herz@keepviennaboring.at. Tell your community’s story with us!

[/td_block_text_with_title][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width=”1/4″][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][td_block_title title_tag=”h4″ content_align_horizontal=”content-horiz-left” custom_title=”Made possible by:”][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column flex_grow=”default” width=”1/1″][vc_row_inner flex_vert_align=”center”][vc_column_inner width=”1/2″ flex_vert_align=”flex-start” vertical_align=”middle” flex_grow=”on” flex_layout=”column” flex_horiz_align=”flex-start”][td_block_text_with_title tdc_css=”eyJwaG9uZSI6eyJtYXJnaW4tdG9wIjoiLTI1IiwiZGlzcGxheSI6IiJ9LCJwaG9uZV9tYXhfd2lkdGgiOjc2N30=”]

[/td_block_text_with_title][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width=”1/2″][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][td_block_title title_tag=”h4″ content_align_horizontal=”content-horiz-left” custom_title=”Partners:” block_template_id=”” tdc_css=”eyJhbGwiOnsibWFyZ2luLXRvcCI6IjUwcHgiLCJkaXNwbGF5IjoiIn19″][vc_row_inner flex_vert_align=”center”][vc_column_inner width=”1/2″ flex_vert_align=”flex-start” vertical_align=”eyJhbGwiOiJtaWRkbGUiLCJwaG9uZSI6InRvcCJ9″ flex_grow=”eyJhbGwiOiJvbiIsInBob25lIjoib2ZmIn0=” flex_layout=”column” flex_horiz_align=”flex-start”][td_block_text_with_title tdc_css=”eyJwaG9uZSI6eyJtYXJnaW4tdG9wIjoiLTUwIiwiZGlzcGxheSI6IiJ9LCJwaG9uZV9tYXhfd2lkdGgiOjc2N30=”]

[/td_block_text_with_title][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width=”1/2″][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][td_block_text_with_title]

The ÖIF provides help with daily online German courses at several language levels and the free learning and teaching offer at www.sprachportal.at. They can help with independent and location-independent study options, practice possibilities and checking your German language skills, with exam preparation or help catching up on missed content.

[/td_block_text_with_title][vc_row_inner flex_vert_align=”center”][vc_column_inner width=”1/2″ flex_vert_align=”flex-start” vertical_align=”middle” flex_grow=”on” flex_layout=”column” flex_horiz_align=”flex-start”][td_block_text_with_title tdc_css=”eyJwaG9uZSI6eyJtYXJnaW4tdG9wIjoiLTUwIiwiZGlzcGxheSI6IiJ9LCJwaG9uZV9tYXhfd2lkdGgiOjc2N30=”]
